title: Panthers within one win of a Cup repeat: Grades for both teams, outlook for Game 6
content: Florida leads Edmonton 3-2 heading home for the next game. Here's how it happened, and what to watch for.

title: Marchand makes history in Panthers' Game 5 win
content: Brad Marchand became the first player to score at least five goals in two separate Stanley Cup Final series with two different teams as the Panthers reached the brink of a second straight Stanley Cup with a 5-2 win over the Oilers.

title: Durant prefers Heat, Spurs, Rockets, sources say
content: The Heat, Spurs and Rockets are Suns star Kevin Durant's preferred trade destinations, sources told ESPN.

title: Burns up 1 at U.S. Open; Scott, Spaun keep pace
content: Sam Burns is one round away from a U.S. Open title but with no margin for error after Saturday's round of 69 left him with a one-shot lead over Adam Scott and J.J. Spaun.

title: Ohtani back in form, homers twice to end drought
content: Shohei Ohtani hit his 24th and 25th homers of the season to halt a 10-game drought Saturday night against the Giants.

title: Clark's 32 help Fever hand first loss to Liberty
content: Caitlin Clark scored a season-high 32 points in her return as the Fever handed the Liberty their first loss of the season.

title: Still got it: Usman tops Buckley in 1st win since '21
content: Kamaru Usman got back on the winning track, outwrestling Joaquin Buckley to score a unanimous decision victory in the main event of UFC Fight Night in Atlanta.

title: Rockies have worst 70-game mark since 1899
content: After Saturday's loss to Atlanta left Colorado with a 13-57 record, the Rockies have the fourth-fewest wins by any team through their first 70 decisions in a season in MLB history and the fewest since the 1899 Spiders.

title: Poch: Pulisic can't dictate which games he plays
content: USMNT coach Mauricio Pochettino said he wouldn't allow Christian Pulisic to dictate which games he would be available for.

title: 📷 Inside the closets of SGA and Haliburton
content: From clutch performances to fashion icons, Shai Gilgeous-Alexander's and Tyrese Haliburton's closets contain the magic.

title: 'It would be incredible': A lot at stake for the four golfers on top of the U.S. Open leaderboard
content: The four golfers leading the U.S. Open heading into the final round might be a surprise. But all four have set themselves up to be a part of history on Sunday.

title: More parity in college baseball? 2025 MCWS could be a glimpse of things to come
content: With six conferences represented, plus an independent, this MCWS might just be a sign of what's to come in the sport.

title: Title leader Oscar Piastri still hopeful after P3 qualifying
content: Formula 1 leader Oscar Piastri stayed hopeful after a qualifying session that had McLaren boss Andrea Stella talking of damage limitation in Sunday's Canadian Grand Prix.

title: An 11-year NBA veteran and the emergency transplant that saved his life
content: Sixteen months ago, Scot Pollard was in active heart failure, about to die. Then came a life-saving transplant, uniting two families -- and two fathers -- forever.

title: How Aaliyah Chavez and her dad bonded through basketball
content: With Father's Day here, the OU signee and her dad reflect on a relationship forged through tough practices together -- a bond that might not have otherwise existed.

title: Cam Ward gives thanks to dad, who drove him all over Texas to help him reach his dreams
content: Tennessee's No. 1 pick credits his dad for emailing coaches and driving him all over Texas just to get him a chance.

title: 'I know he's proud': Brian Schottenheimer leans on life lessons from dad, Marty
content: Dallas' coach spoke of the bond ahead of Father's Day as he follows in the footsteps of Marty, who died in 2021.

title: Dodgers desperately need Shohei Ohtani's arm, but his bat will do -- for now
content: The state of L.A.'s injury-riddled pitching staff is alarming. But Ohtani is too valuable to rush back to the mound.

title: 'Harry Kane is going to score 10 past ya!' Meet Auckland City, the CWC's only amateur team
content: A team full of amateurs will take on Bayern Munich, Benfica and Boca Juniors at the Club World Cup. David vs. Goliath doesn't even begin to describe it.

title: Mega-preview: Predictions, what you need to know about all 32 teams
content: Saturday sees the start of the tournament, with 32 teams playing 63 games between June 14 and July 13.

title: PSG inspired by SoFi as new stadium hunt begins
content: PSG are drawing inspiration from new state-of-the-art venues in Los Angeles as they process of building a new stadium for the team, the club's CEO said.

title: Messi denied late as Miami draws CWC opener
content: Lionel Messi and Inter Miami were held to a scoreless draw against Egypt's Al Ahly in the opening game of the Club World Cup on Saturday night.

title: Tel joins Spurs in permanent deal after loan
content: Tottenham Hotspur have signed Mathys Tel on a permanent transfer from Bayern Munich, the Premier League club has announced.

title: Estêvão focused on CWC ahead of Chelsea move
content: Estêvão has said the move to Chelsea is "a dream come true" while adding that he hopes to end his time at Palmeiras on a high at the Club World Cup this summer.

title: Italy to appoint Gattuso as coach, Buffon confirms
content: Italy are set to appoint their former midfielder Gennaro Gattuso as new head coach to replace the recently sacked Luciano Spalletti, Gianluigi Buffon said.

title: Mexico holds off D.R. to begin Gold Cup with win
content: Defending champion Mexico overcame a slow start to defeat the Dominican Republic 3-2 on Saturday night in a Concacaf Gold Cup group stage match.

title: Inter's Taremi stuck in Iran and will miss CWC
content: Inter Milan forward Mehdi Taremi will not be able to join his teammates at the Club World Cup in the United States as he is stuck in Tehran amid the escalating conflict between Iran and Israel.

title: Reijnders: I'm not at City to replace De Bruyne
content: Tijjani Reijnders insists he's not aiming to replace Kevin De Bruyne at Manchester City despite revealing the Belgian midfielder is one of his idols.

title: The NBA draft's best at 20 different traits, skills: Where Flagg, Bailey and Fears stand out
content: Best clutch player? Top on-ball defender? Elite court vision? We hand out superlatives for this year's class.

title: Overheard at the NBA Finals: Latest buzz on the futures of KD, Giannis and the Knicks
content: What are NBA insiders saying about the biggest offseason storylines? Tim Bontemps and Brian Windhorst canvass the league.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United's Rasmus Højlund wanted by Inter Milan
content: Inter Milan are targeting Rasmus Højlund, with  Man United yet to decide the striker's future. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Debunking the 'Man United tax' myth
content: Transfer chiefs have complained for years, but it's on the club to stop paying over the odds for players.

title: Vice-President Jagdeep Dhankar arrives at Chennai airport
content: He is scheduled to visit Puducherry, where he will take part in events at the Jawaharlal Institute of Postgraduate Medical Education and Research and Pondicherry University

title: Agriculture Minister assures support to mango farmers
content: The procurement began on June 9 and a total of 15,976 metric tonnes of mangoes have been purchased in Chittoor, Tirupati and Annamaya districts till June 12, says Kinjarapu Atchannaidu

title: Kumbakonam railway station poised for redevelopment
content: Southern Railway floats tender for the ₹99-crore station redevelopment project approved by the Railway Board; project to be completed in 18 months from the date of award of work

title: Reckless driving, stunts on two-wheelers make Tiruchi roads unsafe
content: Officials had instructed to monitor stretches that are prone to rash and negligent driving and take serious action against the violators

title: Congress condemns Israel's recent bombings, targeted assassinations on Iranian soil
content: The opposition party asserted that India must speak clearly, act responsibly, and use every diplomatic channel available to defuse tensions and promote a return to dialogue.

title: Watch: Sangh Parivar dynamics in 11 years of Modi
content: This episode of Talking Politics will look at how this relationship developed and changed in this 11 year period between 2014 and 2025

title: HC asks Cochin Devaswom Board to take steps against fake websites of temples
content: Devotees of Sree Poornathrayeesa Temple, Tripunithura, seek directive to the CDB to remove fake websites and take action against those responsible

title: Indian Army honours Kargil war hero's family under 'Ghar-Ghar Shaurya Samman'
content: As part of the 'Ghar-Ghar Shaurya Samman' scheme, the army is honouring the families of martyrs by presenting them with certificates of honour and mementos at their homes.

title: BSF jawan kills senior after heated argument at camp in West Bengal’s Murshidabad
content: Constable Shivam Kumar Mishra fatally shot his senior, Head Constable Ratan Singh Shekhawat, using his service rifle after a heated argument

title: Blistering heat continues in north, central India; hills scorch
content: Experts warn that outdoor workers, the elderly, and children are at high risk of heat exhaustion and heatstroke

title: Tiruchi Rural police patrol teams get body cameras
content: The cameras were handed over to 44 two-wheeler patrol teams, 11 highway patrol teams and the Kollidam and Tiruverumbur patrol vehicles by Superintendent of Police S. Selvanagarathinam

title: Ahead of polls, Assam’s Bodoland council launches land settlement mission
content: Mission Bwiswmuthi 2.0 is designed to ensure land security for small tea growers, rubber cultivators and landless families in the Bodoland Territorial Region

title: Zipline accident: 12-year-old Nagpur girl injured after zipline rope snaps in Manali
content: Trisha suffered several fractures and has been undergoing treatment at a hospital since the accident last week

title: Pune bridge collapse: 2 dead as iron bridge on Indrayani river collapses; NDRF launches rescue operations
content: Three persons were rescued so far following the incident which occurred near Kundamala area in Maval tehsil

title: Two more die of diarrhoea in Odisha’s Jajpur, central team reaches district to assess situation
content: Nearly 1,300 out of 1,500 people diagnosed with diarrhoea have recovered; samples sent for cholera testing

title: Punjab Police foils target killing plot by Canada-based terrorist Arsh Dala, two arrested
content: According to preliminary investigation, the arrested individuals were acting on the directions of Arsh Dala to eliminate rival gang members and extortion targets, DGP Gaurav Yadav posted on X

title: Did Kohli ghost ABD? SA legend admits 'blunder', says 'relieved when he started talking again'
content: South Africa legend AB de Villiers revealed a temporary fallout with Virat Kohli after prematurely disclosing information about Kohli's personal life in early 2024. De Villiers shared that Kohli ceased communication for months following the blunder, which involved publicly announcing Anushka Sharma's pregnancy. He expressed relief when Kohli eventually resumed contact.

title: 'Express my gratitude': PM Modi gets warm welcome in Cyprus - video
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi arrived in Cyprus on Sunday, marking the first visit by an Indian Prime Minister in over two decades. He aims to strengthen ties in trade, investment, and security. Following Cyprus, Modi will attend the G7 Summit in Canada, focusing on global economic stability and climate change, before concluding his tour in Croatia to discuss strategic cooperation.

title: How China dodges the US chip ban: Flying suitcases, renting servers abroad, and ....
content: Facing US restrictions on advanced AI chips, Chinese firms are innovating by processing data abroad. Engineers transported data to Malaysia, utilizing Nvidia chips in local data centers to train AI models. Southeast Asia is becoming a hub for these activities, testing the limits of regulatory oversight as data centers rapidly expand.

title: 11 sixes! DC flop Jake Fraser-McGurk lights up cricket in USA - Watch
content: Jake Fraser-McGurk's explosive 88 off 38 balls propelled San Francisco Unicorns to a formidable 219-8. His innings, featuring eleven sixes, ranks second-highest in Major League Cricket. Partnering with Finn Allen (52), Fraser-McGurk's aggressive batting helped Unicorns defeat Los Angeles Knight Riders by 32 runs. The victory moved SF Unicorns to the top of the league table.

title: Pune bridge collapse: At least 2 dead, over 20 swept away in Indrayani river
content: An iron bridge over the Indrayani river near Pune collapsed on Sunday, resulting in casualties and injuries. Two fatalities have been confirmed, and several individuals are receiving hospital treatment. Rescue operations are ongoing, with an NDRF team assisting efforts to locate those potentially trapped or swept away by the river.

title: MLC: Unmukt Chand smashes quickfire fifty for SRK's team - viral video
content: Unmukt Chand showcased his talent in the MLC season, scoring a half-century for the Los Angeles Knight Riders. Despite his impressive 53 off 32 balls, the team fell short of the target. Chand, aiming for a spot in the USA cricket team, eyes the IPL 2025 mega-auction after retiring from Indian cricket in 2021.

title: Google CEO Sundar Pichai talks AI race; says leading company is like coaching Barcelona
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai addressed criticism about Google's AI progress after ChatGPT's launch and calls for his resignation. He stated he was aware of Google's internal AI developments, including bringing together Brain and DeepMind teams. Pichai emphasized his ability to ignore distractions and focus on important signals, comparing his role to coaching a major sports team.

title: Indian embassy issues advisory for Indians in Iran; shares helpline numbers
content: Amid escalating tensions between Israel and Iran, the Indian Embassy in Iran has issued advisories for Indian nationals. The embassy shared helpline numbers and a Telegram link to provide updates and ensure the safety of Indians currently in Iran.

title: Credit over caution: Household savings in India fall to 18.1% of GDP
content: Indian household savings declined for the third year to 18.1% of GDP. Household debt nearly doubled in ten years. Gross domestic savings also witnessed a dip. Rural India shows promise with rising wages and easing inflation. Retail inflation hit a low of 3.2% in April 2025. The Indian economy grew by 6.5% in FY25. Corporate India is controlling costs.

title: Bumrah's bowling video from England; seamer breathes fires - Watch
content: Ahead of their Test series against England, the Indian cricket team is utilising a non-televised intra-squad match in Beckenham for preparation. Performance analysts from India and India A are employing specialised camera setups to collect crucial match data. This data helps assess player performance and simulate match conditions, ensuring broadcast-quality analysis despite the absence of live television coverage.

title: World's second richest man: Jeff Bezos loses world’s No 2 spot; who's taken his place
content: Larry Ellison surpassed Jeff Bezos to become the world's second-richest person, driven by a $26 billion surge in his net worth following Oracle's strong earnings report. Ellison's total wealth reached $243 billion, exceeding Bezos' $227 billion and Zuckerberg's $239 billion. Elon Musk remains the wealthiest individual with $407.3 billion.

title: Exclusive: Why is chess so cruel? Ask Grandmaster SL Narayanan
content: Grandmaster SL Narayanan, the top-rated player at the Delhi International Open GM Chess Tournament, experienced a disappointing finish after a strong start. Despite aiming for victory, a series of draws against lower-rated opponents led to a seventh-place result. Narayanan reflects on the mental challenges and the importance of maintaining a strong mindset for future success in his chess career.

title: Trump's parade: WH denies Munir invite; BJP demands Congress apology for spreading 'fake news'
content: Bharatiya Janata Party criticized Congress for claiming Pakistan's army chief was invited to a US military parade. The White House denied the claim. BJP MP Nishikant Dubey accused Congress of falling into Pakistan’s trap. Dubey also attacked Congress’s foreign policy history. Donald Trump hosted a military parade. Protests erupted in major cities.

title: Kohli's daughter writes heartwarming note; Anushka shares pic - post goes viral
content: Anushka Sharma celebrated Father's Day with heartfelt posts. She shared a sweet card from daughter Vamika to Virat Kohli. Vamika's adorable note charmed many fans online. Anushka also posted a photo of her father, Ajay Sharma. The Kohli family recently welcomed their son, Akaay. Virat retired from Test cricket in May 2025. The couple continues to protect their children's privacy.

title: U'khand chopper crash: Aryan Aviation operations suspended; licences of 2 pilots revoked
content: Following a fatal helicopter crash near Guptkashi that claimed seven lives, the civil aviation ministry has suspended Aryan Aviation's Char Dham Yatra operations. The Uttarakhand government has also temporarily halted helicopter services on the route and initiated a high-level investigation. The tragic incident, involving a private chopper returning from Kedarnath, prompted the Uttarakhand government to suspend all helicopter services on the Char Dham Yatra route for two days.

title: Wayne Gretzky caught in backlash; Trump calls him ‘a free agent’; Canadians question his loyalty
content: Wayne Gretzky, a Canadian icon, faces backlash for his association with Donald Trump, particularly after Trump's remarks about Canada. Critics question Gretzky's Canadian identity, fueled by images of him at Trump events. Despite Gretzky's attempts to remain neutral, his silence on Trump's policies and his wife's social media activity have intensified the controversy, potentially impacting his legacy in Canada.

title: IND vs ENG: Former cricketer warns Gill, says 'don't go down the wrong path'
content: Aakash Chopra cautions India against prioritising batting depth over bowling strength for the first Test against England at Headingley. He advises captain Shubman Gill to learn from past mistakes and field at least three specialist fast bowlers. Chopra suggests options like Shardul Thakur or a four-pronged pace attack alongside a specialist batter to bolster the team's composition.

title: Happy father's day: 75+ messages, greetings, wishes, and quotes
content: Father's Day, celebrated globally on the third Sunday of June, honors fathers and father figures for their guidance and love. Originating in the US in the early 20th century, Sonora Smart Dodd championed the holiday, officially recognized in 1972. Celebrations vary across cultures, emphasizing family time and appreciation.

title: Gut feeling, gridlock & a mom’s plea – How fate stopped 7 from taking AI 171
content: Seven passengers narrowly avoided tragedy on Air India Flight 171 due to a series of unforeseen circumstances. A mother's heartfelt plea, paperwork issues, a sudden change of heart, traffic delays, and a delayed business trip all conspired to keep them off the ill-fated flight. While some were frustrated at the time, they later realized these obstacles were life-saving interventions.

title: Big win! China cos now exporting ‘Made in India’ products to US
content: Driven by government encouragement and growing local production, Chinese smartphone and electronics manufacturers are now exporting from India to regions like West Asia, Africa, and the US. This marks a strategic shift as brands like Oppo and Realme report significant export earnings.

title: IPL: De Villiers opens up on Delhi Daredevils era; says 'a lot of poisonous characters ...'
content: AB de Villiers described his Delhi Daredevils stint as "bittersweet," highlighting internal chaos and "poisonous characters" despite playing alongside legends like Glenn McGrath and Daniel Vettori. De Villiers felt valued initially but was surprisingly released into the auction after a diminished role in 2010.

title: 'India's blood not meant to be shed': Shah credits PM for tough stance on terror
content: Union home minister Amit Shah credited Prime Minister Modi for a stern message to the world following Operation Sindoor, which retaliated against the Pahalgam terror attack. Speaking in Lucknow, Shah highlighted the Modi government's strong response to terrorism compared to the Congress era.

title: Rs 193cr govt land cleared in Jamnagar crackdown: Hidden dargah, spa-like bath found
content: In Jamnagar, a coordinated police and district administration operation resulted in the reclamation of 7.74 lakh sq ft of illegally occupied government land worth Rs 193 crore. Authorities discovered a hidden dargah with lavish construction, including marble flooring and a sophisticated bathing facility, raising suspicions of illegal activities.

title: IND vs ENG: Gill opens up on becoming Test captain; says 'not even in my ...'
content: Shubman Gill, the rising star, is poised to captain the Indian Test team in the upcoming England series, a role he never envisioned. The 25-year-old expressed his surprise and shared an emotional conversation with his father upon receiving the news. Succeeding Rohit Sharma, Gill has scored 1,893 runs in 32 Tests.

title: Israel struck world's largest gas field: All about South Pars in Iran; why it matters
content: An Israeli air strike has reportedly caused a fire at a key processing unit in Iran's South Pars gas field, leading to a partial suspension of production. The incident, which halted 12 million cubic meters of gas output, marks a significant escalation as it's Israel's first strike on Iran's oil and gas sector.

title: 'Another girl, abort her’: Haryana’s Super 100 saves daughters of state
content: Haryana's Super 100 program is transforming the lives of underprivileged students by providing them with quality education and coaching for competitive exams. Manvi, once discouraged for being a girl, excelled in the program and secured a high-paying job after graduating from IIT Gandhinagar.

title: AI crash: DNA samples match remains of ex-Gujarat CM Vijay Rupani
content: In a tragic turn of events, DNA analysis has confirmed that the remains recovered from the Air India Flight AI171 crash site belong to former Gujarat Chief Minister Vijay Rupani. The ill-fated London-bound flight, carrying 242 passengers, crashed shortly after takeoff from Ahmedabad airport.

title: Israel's Op Rising Lion: Satellite images reveal damage at Iran's nuclear site
content: Satellite images reveal damage to Iranian missile bases in Kermanshah and Tabriz following Israeli strikes. The Natanz nuclear facility also sustained damage, impacting structures supplying power, though underground enrichment halls appear untouched. These attacks, part of Operation Rising Lion, follow escalating tensions and retaliatory strikes between Israel and Iran.

title: ‘Give whole body, not partial remains’: Kin of Ahmedabad plane crash victims
content: The victim identification process in Ahmedabad faces difficulties as officials grapple with the grim task of identifying charred remains. A particularly challenging case involved finding two heads in a single body bag, necessitating a repeat of the DNA testing. Authorities are struggling to console grieving families, who are desperately seeking the complete remains of their loved ones for final rites

title: RBI to tighten rules for overseas remittances by Indians- check what's planned
content: The Reserve Bank of India plans to tighten regulations on international money transfers by Indian residents, targeting foreign currency deposits with lock-in periods. These modifications aim to prevent the Liberalised Remittance Scheme from being used for passive wealth shifting, a concern for the RBI.

title: Israel's 'Op Rising Lion': Trump denies US role; Iran claims 'solid proof' of American support
content: Iran claims to possess evidence implicating US forces in supporting recent Israeli airstrikes, particularly targeting the Natanz nuclear site. US President Trump denied any American involvement, warning Iran against retaliation while suggesting a potential deal between Iran and Israel. The US Secretary of State also stated that US has no role to play in Israeli attacks on Iran.

title: Noida’s ‘Jungle Trail’ to open in July; visitors can enjoy night safari
content: Noida's Jungle Trail, a 20-acre waste-to-wonder park featuring 700 life-sized animal sculptures made from scrap materials, is set for a trial run on June 25 and an official opening in early July. Developed in collaboration with Z-Tech, the park aims to offer an immersive wildlife experience with a night Jungle Safari.

title: Strange radio waves detected beneath Antarctica's ice, scientists still looking for source
content: Researchers in Antarctica detected unusual radio signals emanating from beneath the ice during the ANITA experiment, designed to find high-energy particles. These signals, originating from below the surface, defy explanation by known particles like neutrinos. Scientists are exploring alternative theories, including dark matter or unique radio wave behavior, as the source of the mysterious emissions remains unknown, prompting further investigation.

title: Meet the designer embedding ‘India’s fingerprint in space’ with badge for Shubhanshu Shukla
content: Group Captain Subhanshu Shukla will carry a mission badge designed by Manish Tripathi on the Axiom-4 mission, symbolizing India's space ambitions and cultural heritage. The emblem, a fusion of tradition and technology, features elements like the Gaganyaan icon, Aryabhata satellite, Jantar Mantar observatory, and India's map, representing the nation's journey in space exploration.

title: Kedarnath tragedy: Helicopter services halted for 2 days— What led to crash?
content: Following a tragic helicopter crash near Kedarnath shrine that claimed seven lives, Uttarakhand's chief minister Pushkar Singh Dhami has mandated stringent safety protocols for helicopter services. Preliminary investigations suggest adverse weather and poor visibility contributed to the accident. Dhami has ordered a technical expert committee to formulate a strict Standard Operating Procedure (SOP), ensuring thorough inspections and real-time weather assessments.

title: Creta, Fortuner, Brezza: This family gang stole 25 SUVs in Delhi in past 1 year
content: A family in Delhi ran a car theft ring. The gang stole SUVs from posh areas. Raman, his son Sagar, and son-in-law Neeraj are arrested. They stole and sold 20-25 SUVs in 10 months. The gang targeted Hyundai Creta, Fortuner, and Maruti Brezza cars. They used tools to bypass security. Police reviewed CCTV footage and caught them near Uttam Nagar.

title: ICC World Test Championship 2025-27 full schedule: Who will India face in the new WTC cycle?
content: The ICC has unveiled the schedule for the 2025-27 World Test Championship, featuring 71 matches among nine teams. Sri Lanka and Bangladesh will kick off the cycle on June 17, while Australia is set to play the most Tests with 22 games.

title: China rare earths curbs hit Indian industry hard; cos seeking licenses doubles
content: Indian industries face supply chain disruptions as China tightens export controls on rare earth magnets, a crucial component for automobile manufacturing. The number of Indian firms seeking import permits has nearly doubled, including major players like Bosch and TVS Motor.

title: What was found in Minnesota killer's car? AK-style rifle, ‘No Kings’ flyers & more
content: A manhunt is underway in Minnesota for Vance Boelter, suspected of fatally shooting a former House Speaker and her husband, and wounding a state Senator and his wife. The suspect, who impersonated a police officer, had "No Kings" flyers, linked to anti-Trump protests, in his vehicle.

title: BCCI announces 2025-26 domestic cricket season: Full schedule, groups, dates and key changes
content: The BCCI has unveiled the domestic cricket schedule for 2025-26, starting with the Duleep Trophy on August 28. Zonal selections return for key tournaments, and a Plate Group is introduced for lower-ranked teams to boost competitiveness. Promotion and relegation rules are adjusted, while the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy will feature a Super League stage.

title: 'If attacked US forces will ... ': Trump's warning to Iran; claims he can 'easily' get deal done
content: Amidst escalating tensions in the Middle East following Israel's Operation Rising Lion, Donald Trump issued a stark warning to Iran. He stated that any attack on the US would be met with unprecedented military force. Trump also distanced the US from the Israeli airstrikes, which targeted Iran's nuclear infrastructure and resulted in the deaths of key Iranian figures.

title: 'Thrust not achieved... falling... Mayday': Last words of Air India pilot before crash
content: Air India Flight 171 crashed into a hostel in Ahmedabad after a failed take-off. The pilot's distress call indicated a lack of thrust moments before the crash. Investigators are analyzing the black box to determine the cause of the thrust failure, as initial assessments found no prior warnings or anomalies during the take-off roll.

title: Pilot killed in Uttarakhand chopper crash served in Indian Army for over 15 years
content: Rajveer Singh Chauhan was the captain of Bell 407 helicopter that crashed near Gaurikund in Uttarakhand on Sunday, June 15, 2025, morning

title: Modernisation of police force began in Uttar Pradesh after BJP came to power in 2017: Amit Shah
content: "The Centre's reforms were not visible in Uttar Pradesh from 2014 to 2017," Amit Shah said after distributing job letters to the newly-recruited constables of Uttar Pradesh Police

title: T.T.V. Dhinakaran criticises DMK government over availability of illegal guns, safety of women in Tamil Nadu
content: The AMMK founder further demanded the State Government to not only arrest those involved in the murder of the PMK functionary but also look for the source of the illegal weapon

title: Andhra Pradesh GST Officers and Employees Association expresses concern over frequent transfers
content: Chowdary Purushottam requested the authorities concerned to consider the petitions submitted by the association and individuals for a hassle-free transfer procedure

title: BMTC staff assaults case: Karnataka Transport Minister Ramalinga Reddy urges strict police action
content: The Minister highlighted a recent incident in Bellandur where a woman passenger allegedly hit a BMTC driver with her slipper after he reportedly failed to stop the bus at her desired location

title: Ooty municipality to install CCTV cameras to identify litterers
content: Municipality officials also hope by increasing surveillance, that they will be able to send a message to local communities too to responsibly dispose of their waste

title: Villupuram police bust gang from Uttar Pradesh involved in tampering with ATMs
content: Following a complaint of theft of ₹1.65 lakh at two ATMs located at Maharajapuram and Puducherry Road on June 12, Superintendent of Police P. Saravanan constituted a special police team

title: Air India Ahmedabad-London flight crash: Auto driver turns carpenter; crafts coffins for victims
content: “I’ve delivered 80 coffins so far, with 20 more to go by today evening,” Nilesh Vaghela told The Hindu, his bloodshot eyes betraying three straight days of working 21-hour shifts

title: RPF seizes 5 kg of ganja on board Tatanagar-Yesvantpur Express
content: A statement from Mysuru Division of South Western Railways said a special team conducted a surprise check onboard Tatanagar-Yesvantpur Express as part of Operation NARCOS

title: Three killed, eight injured as speeding truck hits bus in Maharashtra
content: The truck, which was going towards Sangamner from Loni, hit the luxury bus while it was on way towards Shirdi from Mumbai, an official said

title: Heavy rains lash Mumbai, IMD issues yellow alert; orange for neighbouring districts
content: The Weather Department sounded a 'yellow' alert for Mumbai, forecasting heavy showers at isolated places, and an 'orange' alert for neighbouring Thane, Raigad and Palghar districts

title: Man facing multiple criminal cases killed in encounter with cops in Maharashtra
content: The Pune Police received a tip-off a few days ago back that Shahrukh alias was hiding with his relatives in Lamboti village near Solapur, the official said.

title: Gold chain lost in KSR Bengaluru-bound train recovered
content: The complaint was registered under the category of Lost Property and followed up when the coach was detached at Mysuru after the journey for its primary maintenance schedule

title: Indian Rat Snake vying for official reptile of Kerala status
content: The State Board for Wildlife, which will meet next week, will consider a proposal for notifying the snake, also known as Manja Chera and Karinchera as the official reptile

title: News In Frames | Surf, sand and sports
content: Over 1,300 athletes from across India competed in six events in the inaugural edition of Khelo India Beach Games organised in May on Ghoghla Beach near Diu town

title: Moderate to heavy rains continue in Karnataka’s coastal belt; landslip at Kettikal on outskirts of Mangaluru
content: Trains between Mangaluru and Surathkal are running slowly owing to the second landslip between Padil and Jokatte sections

title: Landslip near Nemmar: Vehicle movement on Sringeri-S.K Border affected in Chikkamagaluru district
content: The local police, officers of NHAI and Fire and Emergency services work to restore movement of vehicles

title: Ahmedabad plane crash: DNA confirms identities of 31 victims; 12 bodies handed over
content: Dr. Rajnish Patel, professor of surgery at the government-run B.J. Medical College and Civil Hospital, said DNA matching is still underway for several victims, including former Gujarat Chief Minister Vijay Rupani, who was among those killed in the crash.

title: Police fire on rape accused who attacked officers in Karnataka’s Dandeli
content: Firoz is a rowdy-sheeter who had escaped after raping and robbing a Dalit woman in a forest near Dandeli on June 12, 2025

title: ISRO conducts first successful rocket launching test with payload in U.P.
content: The test conducted on Saturday in collaboration with Thrust Tech India Limited saw the rocket ascend 1.1 km at 5:14:33 p.m., a complete success

title: PM has energy for foreign trips, can he not summon 'empathy' for visiting Manipur: Congress
content: The Opposition party also said this is Mr. Modi's 35th trip abroad since May 2023, and it was "pathetic of the PM to treat Manipur in this awful manner".

title: Book resurrects Assam scientist for millennials
content: ‘Portrait of a Genius’ chronicles the life and contributions of Hiranya Chandra Bhuyan, who died four years before his British mentor won the Nobel Prize for Physics in 1977

title: 3-nation tour chance to thank partner countries for support in fight against cross-border terrorism: PM Modi
content: In his departure statement ahead of his three-nation tour, PM Modi said he looks forward to engaging with leaders from partner countries during the summit at Kananaskis, which he is attending at the invitation of Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney.

title: ‘Zero corruption’ is the ultimate goal, says Naidu
content: People are by and large satisfied with the implementation of various schemes, but there is no room for complacency, he asserts, and directs officials to identify areas where there is corruption and initiate action accordingly

title: Helicopter crashes near Kedarnath shrine, all seven on board killed
content: The helicopter was flying from Kedarnath to Guptkashi; seven on board, including a 10-year-old, have been confirmed dead by Badri-Kedar Temple committee chief

title: TTD warns of strict action against erring health personnel
content: The warning comes in the wake of allegations that certain staff members are extorting large sums of money from local hoteliers on the pretext of inspections

title: Govt. working to clear 85 lakh tonnes of legacy garbage in State, says Municipal Administration Minister Narayana
content: Of it, nearly 45 lakh tonnes has been cleared and the remaining will be lifted in the next three months to meet the one year deadline set by the Chief Minister, he says

title: Use Hindi words instead of Urdu, Persian: Rajasthan’s new directive to police
content: Rajasthan Minister Jawahar Singh Bedham stated that many students preparing for competitive exams in Rajasthan do not study Urdu as their third language, which puts them at a disadvantage when they join the police force and encounter Urdu and Persian terminology.

title: Violence returns to WB jute industry, manager assaulted
content: A senior official of Auckland Jute mill in North 24-Parganas was assaulted following which the management of the Jute mill put a suspension of work notice putting at stake the livelihood of around 4,000 workers.

title: Patna girl Manisha Thapa, having high ambition in life dies in the Air India plane crash
content: Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) leader and ​Bihar Deputy Chief Minister Samrat Choudhary today visited Manisha’s residence in Patna to meet the family members.

title: What India searched for after the Air India plane crash: A digital reflection of collective anxiety
content: Notably, ‘mayday call‘ searches picked up around Thursday afternoon and within an hour, touched 300% increase in searches. The keyword peaked at 4.30 p.m. on June 12, with an 800% increase in searches

title: Govt. does U-turn on appointment of ACP Cubbon Park sub-division
content: Initial order appointing Mr. Kodandarama as ACP revoked, causing drama after ACP Balakrishna’s suspension post-stampede

title: Who takes responsibility when a ship sinks? | Explained
content: What were the two recent shipping-related accidents which have happened across the coast of Kerala? What is a bill of lading? What role does the International Maritime Organization play when it comes to global merchant shipping? What is the SOLAS Convention?

title: How should sexual abuse survivors be treated? | Explained
content: Why was timely medical care denied to a minor rape survivor? What were the guidelines issued by Justice Swarana Kanta Sharma to hospitals about treating sexual assault survivors? Can a sexual assault survivor seek the termination of a pregnancy beyond 24 weeks?

title: RSS’s farmers body criticises NITI Aayog for its suggestion of lowering tariffs on agriculture imports
content: The organisation must reconsider its recommendations and promote self-reliance in agriculture, says Bharatiya Kisan Sangh

title: Amit Shah launches camp for BJP leaders from M.P.; Rajnath Singh, B.L. Santhosh, Shivraj Chouhan to address sessions
content: A State Minister, who is attending the camp, said the event will also include sessions on the “history and growth of the BJP” and on its government in the State

title: Traffic reforms fail to decongest Vyttila
content: Stakeholders, including National Highways Authority of India, Kochi Corpn., and PWD, urged to sit together with police and MVD to chalk out steps such as widening free-left turns to decongest the junction, rather than installing barricades

title: Arambai Tenggol | Manipur’s Black T-Shirts
content: The radical Meitei group, which is accused of violence and looting weapons , says its main goal is to ‘defend and protect Manipur and India’

title: CM Stalin to inaugurate Katpadi’s first full-fledged government hospital
content: The Chief Minister will visit Ranipet, Vellore and Tirupattur districts on June 25-26, where he will handover government welfare assistance to beneficiaries and review ongoing works.

title: Palaniswami criticises Stalin for not being able to get funds under RTE Act
content: The State government must stop playing immediately with the education of children belonging to the poor and the middle class, he says

title: New jumping spider species discovered in southern India; possibly a first for rare genera, say researchers
content:
The discovery possibly marks the first time that the genera Spartaeus and Sonoita groups of the Spartaeinae
 sub-family have been found in India; the jumping spiders are known for their intelligent hunting skills and web-invasion tactics

title: Minister distributes prizes to students at Chennai Press Club
content: HR and CE Minister P.K. Sekar Babu, along with other chief guests, distributed prizes to journalists’ children for their academic performance at a Chennai Press Club event

title: Anbumani plans to hold district general council meetings as a ‘show of strength’
content: He will participate in the district general council meetings to be held between June 15-19 for the 10 district units of the PMK

title: Police shoot, arrest prime suspect in PMK functionary’s murder in Ranipet
content: The police also seized a country-made gun, which the accused used to shoot at the personnel. His accomplice has also been apprehended

title: Residents demand widening of narrow Thazhambur Road
content: Traffic jams, potholes and dust on the single-lane stretch are among the many complaints raised; residents say the road turns slushy during rain

title: Israel, Iran Bombard Each Other: What To Know Of Conflict
content: Israel and Iran traded fire for a third straight day on Sunday, with rising casualties and expanding targets marking a sharp escalation in the conflict between the longtime adversaries.

title: Russia Says It Struck Oil Refinery That Supplies Fuel To Ukrainian Army
content: Russian forces carried out an overnight strike on the Kremenchuk oil refinery that supplies fuel to Ukrainian forces in the Donbas region, Russia's defence ministry said.

title: Cyprus Says Iran Asked Them To Convey 'Some Messages' To Israel
content: Iran has asked Cyprus to convey "some messages" to Israel, President Nikos Christodoulides said on Sunday, adding he expected to speak to Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu later in the day.

title: "Everything Was Destroyed": Israelis Grapple With Damage From Iran Strike
content: In Israel's north, four people were killed earlier when a strike hit the town of Tamra, taking to 13 the death count in the country since the fighting with Iran began on Friday.

title: Teen Witness Who Filmed Ahmedabad Plane Crash Returns Home To Resume Studies
content: Still to overcome the psychological trauma caused by the tragic Air India plane crash he unwittingly ended up capturing on his mobile phone in Ahmedabad, shaken and disturbed Aryan Asari on Sunday returned to his native village in Aravalli.

title: Pune Bridge Collapse Live Updates: Several Feared Drowned In Bridge Collapse Near Pune
content: Several tourists are feared drowned after a bridge on a river near Pune collapsed on Sunday afternoon.

title: "Dangerous": India's Science Chief Flags Liquid Oxygen Leak On Axiom 4
content: India's second astronaut, Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, is set to embark on the Axiom 4 mission from Kennedy Space Center aboard SpaceX's Falcon 9 Crew Dragon.

title: "Simply Not True": Dassault CEO Shoots Down Pak Claim On Indian Rafales
content: Dassault Aviation Chairman and CEO Eric Trappier has dismissed as "factually incorrect" Pakistan's claims about having shot down three Rafale fighter jets of the Indian Air Force (IAF) during Operation Sindoor.

title: Israel-Iran Attack LIVE: Iran Converts Metro Stations, Mosques In Bomb Shelters Amid Israeli Attack
content: Israel-Iran Attack Live: Israel and Iran on Sunday exchanged attacks for the third day, with the Israeli military saying it conducted an "extensive series of strikes" on the headquarters of the Iranian Defence Ministry and the SPND nuclear project.

title: Pilot Killed In Uttarakhand Chopper Crash Served In Army For Over 15 Years
content: Rajveer Singh Chauhan, the pilot of the helicopter that crashed in Uttarakhand early Sunday killing all seven on board, had served in the Indian Army for over 15 years and had vast experience of flying missions over different terrains.

title: 2 Killed After Bridge Collpases Into River Near Pune, Rescue Ops On
content: Two tourists have died and several others are are feared to have drowned after a bridge built over the Indrayani river in Pune collapsed.

title: "Will Inspire A Generation": Murdered Sarpanch's Daughter Clears NEET
content: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar on Sunday took to social media to hail the NEET success of Vaibhavi Deshmukh, the daughter of Beed sarpanch Santosh Deshmukh.

title: Viral Video Shows US Lawmaker In Tears Hours Before Fatal Shooting
content: Hours before being shot and killed, Minnesota representative Melissa Hortman was seen breaking down in tears in a viral video after siding with Republicans on Saturday on cutting healthcare access for undocumented immigrants.

title: Air India Express Kolkata-Hindon Flight Delayed, Plane On Runway For An Hour
content: An Air India Express flight from Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose International Airport in West Bengal to Uttar Pradesh's Hindon Airport was delayed today due to a technical fault identified shortly before takeoff.

title: First Batch Of Pilgrims For Kailash Mansarovar Yatra Departs From UP
content: Chanting "Har Har Mahadev", the first batch of 39 pilgrims was flagged off on Sunday from Ghaziabad for the Kailash Mansarovar Yatra which has resumed after a hiatus of five years.

title: Tension In Manipur Village After Meitei Farmer Alleges Kukis Stopped Him From Ploughing Paddy Field
content: A farmer from the Meitei community who went to plough a paddy field was stopped by some members of the Kuki tribes, leading to tension in a foothill village in the interdistrict border between Manipur's Imphal East and Kangpokpi.

title: 'Bloodshed Of Indians Will Invite Punishment': Amit Shah On Operation Sindoor
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah said on Sunday that through the anti-terror Operation Sindoor, Prime Minister Narendra Modi has sent a strong message across the world that the bloodshed of Indians will invite punishment.

title: Video: Gurugram Man's Dangerous Stunts In Rs 6 Crore Lamborghini
content: A video circulating widely on social media features a young man performing dangerous car stunts on Golf Course Road, one of Gurugram's busiest and most upscale stretches, in a Lamborghini reportedly worth Rs 6 crore.

title: British F-35 Fighter Jet Makes Emergency Landing At Kerala Airport
content: A British F-35 fighter jet made an emergency landing at Thiruvananthapuram airport in Kerala on Saturday.

title: Elon Musk's Starlink Activates Satellite Internet Service In Iran Amid Israel Tensions
content: US tech billionaire Elon Musk has announced that the Starlink satellite communications system has been activated in Iran after Tehran imposed nationwide internet restrictions in the wake of Israeli aggression against Iran.

content: Coastal Carolina has two in the past five . Georgia Southern is coming off its best season in four years . nearly everyone in the Sun Belt has reached solid to great heights of late . if you have to lose every game, that's an awfully impressive sign of parity and general conference health .

title: Betting: Thunder huge favorites ahead of Game 5
